greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Number of iterations x -> 2x-1 needed to get a nonprime number, when starting with x = n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A010051(n) = 0 [when n is a nonprime], a(n) = 0, otherwise a(n) = 1 + a((2*n)-1).
mathematica: Array[Length@ NestWhileList[2 # - 1 &, #, PrimeQ@ # &] - 1 &, 120] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 26 2017 *)
program: def a(n): return 0 if isprime(n) == 0 else 1 + a(2*n - 1) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 26 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 26 2017
